case_vignette: A 45-year-old African-American woman comes to the physician after an episode of hemoptysis! Over the past 8 months, she has had a nonproductive cough, fatigue, and a 9-kg (20-lb) weight loss! She drinks a glass of wine every night and does not smoke! She has a history of hypertension and osteoarthritis! She does not take any medications! She has never traveled out of the country! She works as an accountant! Her temperature is 37!0°C (98!6°F), pulse is 94/min, and blood pressure is 130/90 mm Hg! Lungs are clear to auscultation! An x-ray of the chest shows a 2!5-cm nodule with irregular borders at the apex of the left lung with no mediastinal or hilar enlargement!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_mcq: Squamous cell carcinoma of the lung

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a cough that doesn't produce any mucus, feeling very tired, and I've lost 20 pounds over the past 8 months. I also recently coughed up blood.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I am a 45-year-old woman.
Do you have a history of smoking or exposure to other lung irritants?
No, I do not smoke and have not been exposed to other lung irritants.
Have you experienced any recurrent infections or noticed any unusual bruising or bleeding apart from coughing up blood?
No, I haven't had any recurrent infections or unusual bruising or bleeding apart from coughing up blood.
Do you have any family history of cancer or hematologic diseases?
I haven't mentioned any family history of cancer or hematologic diseases.
Have you been experiencing any other symptoms such as night sweats or fever?
No, I haven't experienced night sweats or fever.
Have you undergone any medical imaging or blood tests recently? What were the results?
Yes, I had a chest x-ray which showed a 2.5-cm nodule with irregular borders at the apex of the left lung, but there was no enlargement of the mediastinum or hilar areas.
Final Diagnosis: Lung Cancer
